events.message: Customer reported a collision involving their car and a streetlight causing front bumper damage.
The claim was categorized under 'Auto Accident' based on keywords indicating a vehicle collision.
An insurance agent was assigned to handle the customer's auto accident claim for further processing.
Customer received an acknowledgement message confirming the receipt of the auto accident claim.
The agent requested the customer to submit the accident report, vehicle photos, and repair estimates.
Customer provided all requested documents including police report, photos of the damaged vehicle, and repair quotes.
The claims team began investigating the circumstances of the auto accident and verifying submitted documents.
Investigation concluded that the insured vehicle was not at fault and damages are covered under the policy.
A settlement amount covering the full repair expenses was proposed and shared with the customer.
Customer expressed satisfaction with the proposed settlement and the overall handling of the accident claim.
The claim was formally approved to proceed with payment after all conditions were met satisfactorily.
Payment corresponding to the approved settlement amount was issued directly to the repair service center.
The auto accident claim was closed following successful payment and repair completion confirmation.
All documentation and correspondence related to the auto accident claim were archived for future reference.
